Sentencas: This paper outlines the development status, issues, and applications of several solid electrolyte electrochemical devices currently being developed by Ceramatec and its partners.
Titulo: Solid electrolyte materials, devices, and applications

Sentencas: Ceramatec and its commercial partner Air Products and Chemicals, Inc., (APCI) have successfully developed and demonstrated an electrochemical device that utilizes a ceria-based, solid electrolyte to separate oxygen from air [1, 2].
Titulo: Solid electrolyte materials, devices, and applications

Sentencas: Other oxygen separator projects utilize ion transport membrane(s) (ITM) composed of mixed ionic and electronic conductors to transport oxygen ions across the membrane by means of a pressure differential driving force to generate high purity oxygen or a chemical reaction driving force to produce synthesis gas from methane (ITM Syngas).
Titulo: Solid electrolyte materials, devices, and applications

Sentencas: Ceramatec, in partnership with SOFCo, demonstrated kilowatt class solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks operating on a variety of fuels such as pipeline natural gas and reformed diesel.
Titulo: Solid electrolyte materials, devices, and applications

Sentencas: Ceramatec is presently working with Cummins and SOFCo to develop low cost modular fuel cells under the Department of Energy's Solid-state Energy Conversion Alliance (SECA) initiative.
Titulo: Solid electrolyte materials, devices, and applications

Sentencas: Some of Ceramatec's other programs are focused on development of gallate electrolyte based fuel cells [3] and metallic bipolar plates
Titulo: Solid electrolyte materials, devices, and applications
